gov.usgs.anss.net

Class UdpTunnel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.net.UdpTunnel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class UdpTunnel
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class is one end of a UdpTunnel. This class will have UdpTunnelListeners which handle the UdpPorts at this end and write data via this tunnel(socket) to another member of this class or an RTS which implements the same interface. The idea is all UdpTunnelListeners registered with this forward their input via the tunnel and all data read from one of these, is written through a UdpTUnnelListener which matches it (or the UTL is created).

      • close

        public void close()
        call this to terminate and shutdown this UdpTunnel permanently. Causes termination of thread at next chance and closes any open socket.

      • reopen

        public void reopen(java.net.Socket s2)
        if a new connection from a particular RTS or other client come in, this routine substitutes the new socket end of the old one so the UdpTunnels do not have to be rebuilt each time one is disconnected for reset. If an open socket end is currently associated, it is closed.
        Parameters:
        s2 - Then new socket end which replaces the old socket end

      • run

        public void run()
        This reads from the socket to an RTS, aligns the packet, and forwards it to The indicated IP/port as a UDP packet Note that if the socket goes "bad" this routine just waits for it to be made good through a call to reopen. Termination is only if the connection is down forever or during shutdown situations
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • write

        public void write(byte[] buf,
                  int len,
                  java.net.InetAddress fromIP,
                  int fromPort,
                  java.net.InetAddress toIP,
                  int toPort)
        write data through the tunnel to be emitted as Udp to the give IP and port
        Parameters:
        buf - The data bytes in an array
        len - Length to write from the buffer (must be <= buf.length)
        fromIP - An InetAddress of where this data came from at this end.
        fromPort - A port where this data came from at this end.
        toIP - An InetAddress of where to send this data at the far end.
        toPort - The port to send the data to at the other end.
